facades

Class UserFacade

  • java.lang.Object
    • facades.UserFacade

  • public class UserFacade
extends Object
    The UserFacade handles the communication with the database. It supports creating, deletion, edit, and retrieval of users.
    Author:
    Daniel, Emil, Jannich, Jimmy

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      UserDTO createUser(String username, String password, String passwordCheck)
      createUser has the purpose of registering a user to the our database, and adds a "user" role by default, to the registered user.
      UserDTO deleteUser(String userName)
      deleteUser deletes the user that is specified from the userName, through our REST endpoint.
      UserDTO editUser(String username, String editedPassword)
      editUser has the purpose of editing a password in the database, to an user.
      List<UserDTO> getAllUsers()
      getAllUsers simply has the purpose of retrieving all users from our database, And return the Username (UserDTO) in a List.

      • createUser

        public UserDTO createUser(String username,
                          String password,
                          String passwordCheck)
                   throws AuthenticationException
        createUser has the purpose of registering a user to the our database, and adds a "user" role by default, to the registered user.
        Parameters:
        username - comes from the user. It is retrieved as a request, from our REST endpoint (register).
        password - is also a request field from our REST endpoint (register).
        passwordCheck - does the same thing, but is a repetition to make sure the passwords are equal.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        AuthenticationException

      • deleteUser

        public UserDTO deleteUser(String userName)
                   throws AuthenticationException,
                          API_Exception
        deleteUser deletes the user that is specified from the userName, through our REST endpoint.
        Parameters:
        userName - is used as the primary key in the DB, and is then the one we search by, because it's unique. The field comes from our REST endpoint (delete)
        Returns:
        Throws:
        AuthenticationException
        API_Exception

      • getAllUsers

        public List<UserDTO> getAllUsers()
                          throws API_Exception
        getAllUsers simply has the purpose of retrieving all users from our database, And return the Username (UserDTO) in a List. Only the username is added in, our UserDTO, as we only want the Username to be shown, so we filter it through our UserDTO.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        API_Exception

      • editUser

        public UserDTO editUser(String username,
                        String editedPassword)
        editUser has the purpose of editing a password in the database, to an user.
        Parameters:
        username - This is used to identify the user we will be updating the password for. Gets retrieved from our Endpoint.
        editedPassword - This the password we will be changing the user to, in the DB. Gets retrieved from our Endpoint.
        Returns:
